title: Fix: Multiple lint and TypeScript errors in MCP package
description:
Fix 133 lint problems (98 errors, 35 warnings) across multiple files in the MCP package. Main issues include:

1. Missing Node.js globals (process, console, NodeJS) definitions in test files
2. Unused variables and imports in multiple files
3. Unreachable code in chat-tools.ts
4. Non-null assertions and explicit 'any' types
5. ESLint configuration issues for Node.js environment

Files affected:
- packages/mcp/src/__tests__/*.test.ts (Node globals)
- packages/mcp/src/index.ts (process, console globals)
- packages/mcp/src/mcp-adapter.ts (unused imports, variables)
- packages/mcp/src/tools/chat-tools.ts (major issues with unreachable code)
- packages/mcp/src/tools/workspace-tools.ts (explicit any types)
- packages/mcp/src/utils/common.ts (unused variables)

notes.content:
Fixed initial issues in mcp-adapter.ts:
- Removed unused imports (AIContext, DevlogEntry)
- Changed 'let' to 'const' for summary variable
- Removed unused 'updated' variable
- Fixed explicit 'any' types by using proper DevlogStatus[] and typed object
- Added Node.js globals to ESLint config

Major progress on lint fixes:
- Fixed ESLint config to include Node.js globals (process, console, NodeJS)
- Fixed all unreachable code issues in chat-tools.ts by removing try-catch blocks
- Fixed unused imports in mcp-adapter.ts and chat-tools.ts
- Fixed explicit 'any' types in mcp-adapter.ts with proper DevlogStatus[]
- Added ESLint disable comments for stub functions in chat-tools.ts
- Fixed 'any' type in utils/common.ts (unknown instead)
- Working on remaining 'any' types in workspace-tools.ts

Remaining: workspace-tools.ts any types, final testing

context.technicalContext: The MCP package is missing proper ESLint configuration for Node.js environment, causing process/console/NodeJS globals to be undefined. There are also several code quality issues with unused variables, imports, and unreachable code paths.
acceptanceCriteria: All unused imports and variables removed
All tests continue to pass after fixes
